butools.mc.CRPSolve

butools.mc.CheckGenerator

butools.mc.DRPSolve¶

butools.mc.DRPSolve()¶
Matlab: pi = DRPSolve(Q, prec)
Mathematica: pi = DRPSolve[Q, prec]
Python/Numpy: pi = DRPSolve(Q, prec)

Computes the stationary solution of a discrete time Markov chain.

Parameters:

P : matrix, shape (M,M)

The matrix parameter of the rational process

prec : double, optional

Numerical precision for checking the rowsums. The default value is 1e-14.
Returns:

pi : row vector, shape (1,M)

The vector that satisfies \(\pi\, P = \pi, \sum_i \pi_i=1\)

Notes

Discrete time rational processes are like discrete time Markov chains, but the P matrix does not have to pass the CheckProbMatrix() test (but the rowsums still have to be ones).

Examples

For Matlab:

>>> Q=[-0.9 0.5 1.4; 0.9 -0.9 1; 0.3 1.3 -0.6];
>>> pi=DRPSolve(Q)
[0.23138 0.3484 0.42021]
>>> sum(pi)
1
>>> pi*Q - pi
[1.6653e-16 -5.5511e-17 -1.1102e-16]

For Mathematica:

>>> q={{-0.9, 0.5, 1.4}, {0.9, -0.9, 1}, {0.3, 1.3, -0.6}}
>>> pi=DRPSolve[q]

For Python/Numpy:

>>> q=[[-0.9, 0.5, 1.4], [0.9, -0.9, 1], [0.3, 1.3, -0.6]]
>>> pi=DRPSolve(q)
